ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I continued to advance my knowledge and skills with the Czech language.
Learned basics of czech language. Very helpful
I deepened my knowledge of the Czech language this semester.
Strengthened my learning in Czech from the first semester.
This course solidified basic Czech grammar and taught us remarkable reading skills by the end of the semester.
I learned a lot about czech culture and language.
Knowledge of Czech

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course was well designed and well taught, I thoroughly enjoyed it with no complaints.
This is not a built-for-zoom course. I still have not experienced it in person, but Professor von Kunes is so kind and helpful when students want to understand.
I thought it was excellent.

This course was absolutely wonderful! Prof. von Kunes kept the class engaging with a variety of activities, videos, and exercises. I would have appreciated a little bit more speaking practice, but all in all, this was an incredible class.
Its hard learning a language over zoom

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Live lecture was great, and Dr. Von Kunes did a great job of adjusting by using forms of online media and other virtual learning tools.
I thought the zoom app worked great for this class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! If you are interested in taking a new language at Yale, look no further than Czech. Dr. Von Kunes is one of the kindest and most humble/personable professors at Yale!
Yes really enjoyed the class and the professor.
Yes. Great Professor and curriculum
Of course! Czech is an amazing language, and Prof. von Kunes brings it alive in class (even over Zoom). Her energy and compassion for her students cannot be matched.
YEEESSSSSSSS
I would because it is an interesting language to learn

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: NA
Written homework and short films.
None.
